Program

Program details

We’re excited to host this two-day event in Mexico City, co-located with NAACL 2024.

  • First Day (June 14): Dive into insightful Keynotes and engaging Panels from experts in the field.
  • Second Day (June 15): Participate in interactive Tutorials for practical NLP learning experiences.
Friday, June 14
Progam Start End Name Rooms
Registration 8:20 8:50 Registration Adelita
Opening Session 8:50 9:00 Welcome Opening Session
Keynote 9:00 10:00 Human Centered NLP for Positive Impact (Diyi Yang)
Keynote 10:00 11:00 A tricky intersection: Natural language processing and endangered language documentation (Alexis Palmer)
AM Coffee Break 11:00 11:30 Coffee in Foyer
Panel A 11:30 13:00 From "publish or perish" to "publicize or perish": Navigating challenges and opportunities for career advancement in Latin American Communities in the current era of scientific publication trends.
Lunch 13:00 14:30 Lunch on own
Keynote 14:30 15:30 Combatting Human Trafficking in the Cyberspace: An NLP-Based Methodology to Analyze Online Advertisements (Pablo Rivas)
Keynote 15:30 16:30 NLP for Timely and Actionable Feedback in Healthcare Conversations (Veronica Perez Rosas)
PM Coffee Break 16:30 17:00 Coffee in Foyer
Panel B 17:00 18:30 Perspectivas de NLP desde Latinoamérica / NLP perspectives, an overview from Latin America.
Saturday, June 15
Progam Start End Name Rooms
Tutorial A 9:00 10:30 Training Lightweight Model via Knowledge Distillation and Parameter Efficient Finetuning (Alham Fikri Aji / English) Adelita
Tutorial B 9:00 10:30 Introduction to Attention Mechanisms in Transformers (Víctor Mijangos / Spanish) Julian
AM Coffee Break 10:30 11:00 Coffee & Tea in Foyer
Tutorial A 11:00 12:30 Training Lightweight Model via Knowledge Distillation and Parameter Efficient Finetuning (Alham Fikri Aji / English) Adelita
Tutorial B 11:00 12:30 Introduction to Attention Mechanisms in Transformers (Víctor Mijangos / Spanish) Julian
Lunch 12:30 14:00 Lunch on own
Tutorial C 14:00 16:00 Exploring Transformers and Limitations in Language Modeling (Danae Sánchez / Spanish) Adelita
Tutorial D 14:00 16:00 The Power of Rewards - Reinforcing Language Models with Reinforcement Learning (Sudipta Kar / English) Julian
PM Coffee Break 16:00 16:30 Coffee & Tea in Foyer
Panel C 16:30 18:00 Getting into NLP: Insights from experts and peers. Adelita
Closing session 18:00 18:30 Closing session and final remarks. Adelita

Don’t miss this opportunity for valuable learning and networking in the field of Natural Language Processing!
